Introduction to cancR

Mathias Ørholt

cancR.Rmd

This is an introduction to the cancR package.The article describes the workflow and main functions in the cancR package with in-depth examples.

Preparation

The cancR package is installed through github, see separate article.

library(cancR)

To demonstrate the functions useful in data management, we load the simulated redcap dataframe

df <- redcap_df

Data management

The following functions are useful in data management tasks

summarisR

To get a graphical glimpse of the data we can use the summarisR() function:

missR

And to exploit the number of missing values we use the missR() function

missR(df)
#> Nas detected in the following variables:
#> 
#>          variable NAs
#> 1 metastasis_date 335
#> 2      death_date 302
#> 3 recurrence_date 258
#> 4        necrosis 183
#> 5           sox10 168
#> 6              ck 156
#> 7            cd10 149

We can also check if numerical variables are normally distributed with the distributR() function

distributR 

distributR(df,
           vars = size)
